revised_title: The Effect of Plants on Carbon Dioxide Levels and the Measurement of Actinism
tldr: The author conducted experiments to measure the actinism of sunlight and daylight and their effect on carbon dioxide levels. They discovered that plants absorb carbon dioxide during the day and release it at night, affecting the amount of carbon dioxide in the air. The author also developed a method to measure the total light absorbed by gases, vapors, and floating solids using iodide of potassium and nitric acid.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Ecology and Ecosystems
